014package org.microbean.construct;
015
016import java.util.List;
017import java.util.Objects;
018
019import javax.lang.model.element.Element;
020import javax.lang.model.element.ExecutableElement;
021import javax.lang.model.element.ModuleElement;
022import javax.lang.model.element.Name;
023import javax.lang.model.element.PackageElement;
024import javax.lang.model.element.Parameterizable;
025import javax.lang.model.element.QualifiedNameable;
026import javax.lang.model.element.RecordComponentElement;
027import javax.lang.model.element.TypeElement;
028import javax.lang.model.element.TypeParameterElement;
029import javax.lang.model.element.VariableElement;
030
031import javax.lang.model.type.ArrayType;
032import javax.lang.model.type.DeclaredType;
033import javax.lang.model.type.ExecutableType;
034import javax.lang.model.type.NoType;
035import javax.lang.model.type.NullType;
036import javax.lang.model.type.PrimitiveType;
037import javax.lang.model.type.TypeKind;
038import javax.lang.model.type.TypeMirror;
039import javax.lang.model.type.TypeVariable;
040import javax.lang.model.type.WildcardType;
041
042import static javax.lang.model.element.ElementKind.CONSTRUCTOR;
043import static javax.lang.model.element.ElementKind.METHOD;
044
045/**
046 * A representation of a domain of valid Java constructs.
047 *
048 * <p>A <dfn id="domain">domain</dfn> is a set of valid Java <a href="#construct">constructs</a>. A {@link Domain}
049 * provides access to a domain and its members.</p>
050 *
051 * <p>A Java <dfn id="construct">construct</dfn> is either a <a href="#type">type</a> or an <a
052 * href="#element">element</a>.</p>
053 *
054 * <p>A <dfn id="type">type</dfn> is a usage of a Java type, most commonly represented as a {@link TypeMirror}.</p>
055 *
056 * <p>An <dfn id="element">element</dfn> ia a declaration of a Java program element, most commonly represented as an
057 * {@link Element}.</p>
058 *
059 * <p>Domains impose constraints on the <a href="#type">types</a> and <a href="#element">elements</a> they contain, and
060 * on the kinds and semantics of operations that can be performed on them.</p>
061 *
062 * <p>This interface is modeled on a deliberately restricted combination of the {@link javax.lang.model.util.Elements}
063 * and {@link javax.lang.model.util.Types} interfaces.</p>
064 *
065 * <p>{@link Domain} implementations must be thread-safe.</p>
066 *
067 * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson" target="_top">Laird Nelson</a>
068 */
069@SuppressWarnings("try")
070public interface Domain {
071
072  /**
073   * Returns an {@link ArrayType} whose {@linkplain ArrayType#getComponentType() component type} is {@linkplain
074   * #sameType(TypeMirror, TypeMirror) the same as} the supplied {@code componentType}.
075   *
076   * @param componentType the component type; must not be {@code null}
077   *
078   * @return a non-{@code null} {@link ArrayType} whose {@linkplain ArrayType#getComponentType() component type} is
079   * {@linkplain #sameType(TypeMirror, TypeMirror) the same as} the supplied {@code componentType}
080   *
081   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code componentType} is {@code null}
082   *
083   * @exception IllegalArgumentException if {@code componentType} is not a valid component type
084   *
085   * @see javax.lang.model.util.Types#getArrayType(TypeMirror)
086   */
087  public ArrayType arrayTypeOf(final TypeMirror componentType);
088
089  /**
090   * Returns the {@link Element} declaring the supplied {@link TypeMirror}, or {@code null} if there is no such {@link
091   * Element}.
092   *
093   * @param t a {@link TypeMirror}; must not be {@code null}
094   *
095   * @return an {@link Element}, or {@code null}
096   *
097   * @see javax.lang.model.util.Types#asElement(TypeMirror)
098   */
099  public Element asElement(final TypeMirror t);
100
101  /**
102   * Returns a non-{@code null} {@link TypeMirror} representing the type of the supplied {@link Element} when that
103   * {@link Element} is viewed as a member of, or otherwise directly contained by, the supplied {@code containingType}.
104   *
105   * <p>For example, when viewed as a member of the parameterized type {@link java.util.Set Set&lt;String&gt;}, the
106   * {@link java.util.Set#add(Object)} method (represented as an {@link ExecutableElement}) {@linkplain
107   * ExecutableElement#asType() has} a {@linkplain ExecutableType type} whose {@linkplain
108   * ExecutableType#getParameterTypes() method parameter is of type} {@link String} (not {@link String}'s erasure).</p>
109   *
110   * @param containingType the containing {@link DeclaredType}; must not be {@code null}
111   *
112   * @param e the member {@link Element}; must not be {@code null}
113   *
114   * @return a non-{@code null} {@linkplain TypeMirror type} representing the {@linkplain Element#asType() type of} the
115   * supplied {@link Element} when viewed as a member of the supplied {@code containingType}; never {@code null}
116   *
117   * @exception NullPointerException if either {@code containingType} or {@code e} is {@code null}
118   *
119   * @exception IllegalArgumentException if {@code e} cannot be viewed as a member of the supplied {@code
120   * containingType} (because it is the wrong {@linkplain Element#getKind() kind}, for example)
121   *
122   * @see javax.lang.model.util.Types#asMemberOf(DeclaredType, Element)
123   */
124  public TypeMirror asMemberOf(final DeclaredType containingType, final Element e);
125
126  /**
127   * Returns {@code true} if and only if the supplied {@code payload} (the first argument) is considered assignable to
128   * the supplied {@code receiver} (the second argument) according to <a
129   * href="https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se21/html/jls-5.html#jls-5.2">the rules of the Java Language
130   * Specification</a>.
131   *
132   * @param payload the {@link TypeMirror} being assigned; must not be {@code null}
133   *
134   * @param receiver the {@link TypeMirror} receiving the assignment; must not be {@code null}
135   *
136   * @return {@code true} if and only if {@code payload} is assignable to {@code receiver}
137   *
138   * @exception NullPointerException if either {@code payload} or {@code receiver} is {@code null}
139   *
140   * @exception IllegalArgumentException if either {@link TypeMirror} is not one that can take part in an assignment
141   *
142   * @see javax.lang.model.util.Types#isAssignable(TypeMirror, TypeMirror)
143   *
144   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se21/html/jls-5.html#jls-5.2 Java Language Specification, section
145   * 5.2
146   */
147  // Note the strange positioning of payload and receiver.
148  public boolean assignable(final TypeMirror payload, final TypeMirror receiver);
149
150  /**
151   * Returns the (non-{@code null}) <a
152   * href="https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se21/html/jls-13.html#jls-13.1"><dfn>binary name</dfn></a> of the
153   * supplied {@link TypeElement}.
154   *
155   * @param e a {@link TypeElement}; must not be {@code null}
156   *
157   * @return a non-{@code null} {@link Name}
158   *
159   * @see javax.lang.model.util.Elements#getBinaryName(TypeElement)
160   *
161   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se21/html/jls-13.html#jls-13.1 Java Language Specification, section
162   * 13.1
163   */
164  public Name binaryName(final TypeElement e);
165
166  /**
167   * Applies <a href="https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-5.html#jls-5.1.10"><dfn>capture
168   * conversion</dfn></a> to the supplied {@link TypeMirror}, which is normally a {@linkplain TypeKind#WILDCARD wildcard
169   * type}.
170   *
171   * @param wildcard a {@link TypeMirror}; must not be {@code null}; if not a {@linkplain TypeKind#WILDCARD wildcard
172   * type}, then it will be returned unchanged
173   *
174   * @return a non-{@code null} {@link TypeMirror} representing the result of <a
175   * href="https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-5.html#jls-5.1.10">capture conversion</a> applied to
176   * the supplied {@link TypeMirror}
177   *
178   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code wildcard} is {@code null}
179   *
180   * @see javax.lang.model.util.Types#capture(TypeMirror)
181   *
182   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-5.html#jls-5.1.10 Java Language Specification, section
183   * 5.1.10
184   */
185  public TypeMirror capture(final TypeMirror wildcard);
186
187  /**
188   * Returns {@code true} if and only if {@code candidateContainer} <dfn>contains</dfn> {@code candidate}, according to
189   * the <a href="https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.5.1">Java Language Specification,
190   * section 4.5.1</a>.
191   *
192   * @param candidateContainer the putative containing type; normally a {@linkplain TypeKind#WILDCARD wildcard type};
193   * must not be {@code null}
194   *
195   * @param candidate the putative contained type; must not be {@code null}
196   *
197   * @return {@code true} if and only if {@code candidateContainer} <dfn>contains</dfn> {@code candidate}, according to
198   * the <a href="https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.5.1">Java Language Specification,
199   * section 4.5.1</a>; {@code false} otherwise
200   *
201   * @exception NullPointerException if either argument is {@code null}
202   *
203   * @exception IllegalArgumentException if either argument is either an {@linkplain TypeKind#EXECUTABLE executable
204   * type}, a {@linkplain TypeKind#MODULE module type}, or a {@linkplain TypeKind#PACKAGE package type}
205   *
206   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.5.1 Java Language Specification, section
207   * 4.5.1
208   */
209  public boolean contains(final TypeMirror candidateContainer, final TypeMirror candidate);
210
211  /**
212   * A convenience method that returns the {@link DeclaredType} {@linkplain TypeElement#asType() of} a {@link
213   * TypeElement} that bears the supplied {@code canonicalName}, or {@code null} if there is no such {@link TypeElement}
214   * (and therefore no such {@link DeclaredType}).
215   *
216   * @param canonicalName a valid canonical name; must not be {@code null}
217   *
218   * @return a {@link DeclaredType} with a {@link TypeKind} of {@link TypeKind#DECLARED}, or {@code null}
219   *
220   * @see #typeElement(CharSequence)
221   *
222   * @see #declaredType(TypeElement, TypeMirror...)
223   *
224   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-6.html#jls-6.7 Java Language Specification, section
225   * 6.7
226   */
227  public default DeclaredType declaredType(final CharSequence canonicalName) {
228    final TypeElement e = this.typeElement(canonicalName);
229    return e == null ? null : this.declaredType(e);
230  }
231
232  /**
233   * Returns the {@link DeclaredType} {@linkplain TypeElement#asType() of} the supplied {@link TypeElement} with the
234   * supplied {@link TypeMirror} arguments (if any), yielding a parameterized type.
235   *
236   * <p>Given a {@link TypeElement} representing the class named {@link java.util.Set java.util.Set} and a {@link
237   * TypeMirror} representing the type declared by {@link String java.lang.String}, for example, this method will return
238   * a {@link DeclaredType} representing the parameterized type corresponding to {@link java.util.Set
239   * java.util.Set&lt;java.lang.String&gt;}.</p>
240   *
241   * <p>The number of supplied type arguments must either equal the number of the supplied {@link TypeElement}'s
242   * {@linkplain TypeElement#getTypeParameters() formal type parameters}, or must be zero. If it is zero, and if the
243   * supplied {@link TypeElement} {@link #generic(Element) is generic}, then the supplied {@link TypeElement}'s raw type
244   * is returned.</p>
245   *
246   * <p>If a parameterized type is returned, {@linkplain DeclaredType#asElement() its <code>TypeElement</code>} must not
247   * be contained within a {@linkplain #generic(Element) generic} outer class. The parameterized type {@code
248   * Outer<String>.Inner<Number>}, for example, may be constructed by first using this method to get the type {@code
249   * Outer<String>}, and then invoking {@link #declaredType(DeclaredType, TypeElement, TypeMirror...)}.</p>
250   *
251   * @param typeElement a {@link TypeElement}; must not be {@code null}
252   *
253   * @param typeArguments any type arguments (represented by {@link TypeMirror}s); must not be {@code null}
254   *
255   * @return a non-{@code null} {@link DeclaredType} with a {@link TypeKind} of {@link TypeKind#DECLARED}
256   *
257   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code typeElement} or {@code typeArguments} is {@code null}
258   *
259   * @see javax.lang.model.util.Types#getDeclaredType(TypeElement, TypeMirror...)
260   *
261   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.5 Java Language Specification, section 4.5
262   */
263  public DeclaredType declaredType(final TypeElement typeElement,
264                                   final TypeMirror... typeArguments);
265
266  /**
267   * Returns the {@link DeclaredType} {@linkplain TypeElement#asType() of} the supplied {@link TypeElement} with the
268   * supplied {@link TypeMirror} arguments (if any), given a containing {@link DeclaredType} of which it is a member,
269   * yielding a parameterized type.
270   *
271   * <p>Given a {@link DeclaredType} representing the parameterized type corresponding to {@code Outer<}{@link
272   * String}{@code >} (see the {@link #declaredType(TypeElement, TypeMirror...)} method), a {@link TypeElement}
273   * representing the class named {@code Outer.Inner} and a {@link DeclaredType} representing the non-generic class
274   * corresponding to {@link Number}, for example, this method will return a {@link DeclaredType} representing the
275   * parameterized type corresponding to {@code Outer<}{@link String}{@code >}{@code .Inner<}{@link Number}{@code >}.</p>
276   *
277   * <p>The number of supplied type arguments must either equal the number of the supplied {@link TypeElement}'s
278   * {@linkplain TypeElement#getTypeParameters() formal type parameters}, or must be zero. If it is zero, and if the
279   * supplied {@link TypeElement} {@link #generic(Element) is generic}, then the supplied {@link TypeElement}'s raw type
280   * is returned.</p>
281   *
282   * @param enclosingType a {@link DeclaredType} representing the containing type; must not be {@code null}
283   *
284   * @param typeElement a {@link TypeElement}; must not be {@code null}
285   *
286   * @param typeArguments any type arguments (represented by {@link TypeMirror}s); must not be {@code null}
287   *
288   * @return a non-{@code null} {@link DeclaredType} with a {@link TypeKind} of {@link TypeKind#DECLARED}
289   *
290   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code enclosingType}, {@code typeElement}, or {@code typeArguments} is {@code
291   * null}
292   *
293   * @see #declaredType(TypeElement, TypeMirror...)
294   *
295   * @see javax.lang.model.util.Types#getDeclaredType(DeclaredType, TypeElement, TypeMirror...)
296   *
297   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.5 Java Language Specification, section 4.5
298   */
299  public DeclaredType declaredType(final DeclaredType enclosingType,
300                                   final TypeElement typeElement,
301                                   final TypeMirror... typeArguments);
302
303  /**
304   * Returns a non-{@code null} {@link List} of the <dfn>direct supertypes</dfn> of the supplied {@link TypeMirror},
305   * which is normally a {@linkplain TypeKind#DECLARED declared type}.
306   *
307   * @param t a {@link TypeMirror}; must not be {@code null}; must not be an {@linkplain TypeKind#EXECUTABLE executable
308   * type}, a {@linkplain TypeKind#MODULE module type}, or a {@linkplain TypeKind#PACKAGE package type}
309   *
310   * @return a non-{@code null}, immutable {@link List} of {@link TypeMirror}s representing the direct supertypes
311   *
312   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code t} is {@code null}
313   *
314   * @exception IllegalArgumentException if either argument is either an {@linkplain TypeKind#EXECUTABLE executable
315   * type}, a {@linkplain TypeKind#MODULE module type}, or a {@linkplain TypeKind#PACKAGE package type}
316   *
317   * @see javax.lang.model.util.Types#directSupertypes(TypeMirror)
318   *
319   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.10 Java Language Specification, section
320   * 4.10
321   */
322  public List<? extends TypeMirror> directSupertypes(final TypeMirror t);
323
324  /**
325   * Returns the {@link Element} responsible for declaring the supplied {@link TypeMirror}, which is most commonly a
326   * {@link DeclaredType}, a {@link TypeVariable}, a {@link NoType} with a {@link TypeKind} of {@link TypeKind#MODULE},
327   * or a {@link NoType} with a {@link TypeKind} of {@link TypeKind#PACKAGE}, or {@code null} if there is no such {@link
328   * Element}.
329   *
330   * @param t a {@link TypeMirror}; must not be {@code null}
331   *
332   * @return an {@link Element}, or {@code null}
333   *
334   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code t} is {@code null}
335   *
336   * @see javax.lang.model.util.Types#asElement(TypeMirror)
337   */
338  public Element element(final TypeMirror t);
339
340  /**
341   * Returns the <dfn>erasure</dfn> of the supplied {@link TypeMirror}.
342   *
343   * @param <T> a {@link TypeMirror} specialization
344   *
345   * @param t the {@link TypeMirror} representing the type whose erasure should be returned; must not be {@code null}
346   *
347   * @return the erasure of the supplied {@link TypeMirror}; never {@code null}
348   *
349   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code t} is {@code null}
350   *
351   * @exception IllegalArgumentException if {@code t} is a {@link NoType} with a {@link TypeKind} of {@link
352   * TypeKind#MODULE}, or a {@link NoType} with a {@link TypeKind} of {@link TypeKind#PACKAGE}
353   *
354   * @see javax.lang.model.util.Types#erasure(TypeMirror)
355   *
356   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.6 Java Language Specification, section
357   * 4.6
358   */
359  public <T extends TypeMirror> T erasure(final T t);
360
361  /**
362   * A convenience method that returns an {@link ExecutableElement} representing the static initializer, constructor or
363   * method described by the supplied arguments, or {@code null} if no such {@link ExecutableElement} exists.
364   *
365   * @param declaringElement a {@link TypeElement} representing the class that declares the executable; must not be
366   * {@code null}
367   *
368   * @param returnType the {@linkplain ExecutableElement#getReturnType() return type} of the executable; must not be
369   * {@code null}
370   *
371   * @param name the {@linkplain ExecutableElement#getSimpleName() name} of the executable; must not be {@code null}
372   *
373   * @param parameterTypes {@link TypeMirror}s that represent the executable's {@linkplain
374   * ExecutableElement#getParameters() parameter types}
375   *
376   * @return an {@link ExecutableElement} with an {@link javax.lang.model.element.ElementKind} of {@link
377   * javax.lang.model.element.ElementKind#CONSTRUCTOR}, {@link javax.lang.model.element.ElementKind#METHOD}, or {@link
378   * javax.lang.model.element.ElementKind#STATIC_INIT}, or {@code null}
379   *
380   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
381   */
382  public default ExecutableElement executableElement(final TypeElement declaringElement,
383                                                     final TypeMirror returnType,
384                                                     final CharSequence name,
385                                                     final TypeMirror... parameterTypes) {
386    try (var lock = this.lock()) {
387      final List<? extends Element> ees = declaringElement.getEnclosedElements();
388      return ees.stream()
389        .sequential()
390        .filter(e -> e.getKind().isExecutable() && e.getSimpleName().contentEquals(name))
391        .map(ExecutableElement.class::cast)
392        .filter(ee -> {
393            if (!this.sameType(returnType, ee.getReturnType())) {
394              return false;
395            }
396            final List<? extends VariableElement> ps = ee.getParameters();
397            if (ps.size() != parameterTypes.length) {
398              return false;
399            }
400            for (int i = 0; i < parameterTypes.length; i++) {
401              if (!this.sameType(ps.get(i).asType(), parameterTypes[i])) {
402                return false;
403              }
404            }
405            return true;
406          })
407        .findFirst()
408        .orElse(null);
409    }
410  }
411
412  /**
413   * A convenience method that returns {@code true} if and only if the supplied {@link Element} is <dfn>generic</dfn>.
414   *
415   * @param e an {@link Element}; must not be {@code null}
416   *
417   * @return {@code true} if and only if the supplied {@link Element} is <dfn>generic</dfn>; {@code false} otherwise
418   *
419   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code e} is {@code null}
420   *
421   * @see Parameterizable
422   *
423   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-8.html#jls-8.1.2 Java Language Specification, section
424   * 8.1.2
425   *
426   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-8.html#jls-8.4.4 Java Language Specification, section
427   * 8.4.4
428   *
429   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-8.html#jls-8.8.4 Java Language Specification, section
430   * 8.8.4
431   *
432   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-9.html#jls-9.1.2 Java Language Specification, section
433   * 9.1.2
434   */
435  public default boolean generic(final Element e) {
436    if (Objects.requireNonNull(e, "e") instanceof Parameterizable p) {
437      try (var lock = this.lock()) {
438        return switch (e.getKind()) {
439        case CLASS, CONSTRUCTOR, ENUM, INTERFACE, METHOD, RECORD -> !p.getTypeParameters().isEmpty();
440        default -> false;
441        };
442      }
443    }
444    return false;
445  }
446
447  /**
448   * A convenience method that returns the {@link TypeElement} representing the class named {@link Object
449   * java.lang.Object}.
450   *
451   * @return a non-{@code null} {@link TypeElement} whose {@linkplain TypeElement#getQualifiedName() qualified name} is
452   * {@linkplain Name#contentEquals(CharSequence) equal to} {@code java.lang.Object}
453   *
454   * @see #typeElement(CharSequence)
455   */
456  public default TypeElement javaLangObject() {
457    return this.typeElement("java.lang.Object");
458  }
459
460  /**
461   * Semantically locks an opaque lock used to serialize symbol completion, and returns it in the form of an {@link
462   * Unlockable}.
463   *
464   * <p>Implementations of this method must not return {@code null}.</p>
465   *
466   * @return an {@link Unlockable} in a semantically locked state; never {@code null}
467   *
468   * @see Unlockable#close()
469   */
470  public Unlockable lock();
471
472  /**
473   * Returns a {@link ModuleElement} representing the module {@linkplain ModuleElement#getQualifiedName() named} by the
474   * supplied {@code qualifiedName}, or {@code null} if there is no such {@link ModuleElement}.
475   *
476   * @param qualifiedName a name suitable for naming a module; must not be {@code null}; may be {@linkplain
477   * CharSequence#isEmpty() empty}, in which case a {@link ModuleElement} representing an <dfn>unnamed module</dfn> will
478   * be returned
479   *
480   * @return a {@link ModuleElement}, or {@code null}
481   *
482   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code qualifiedName} is {@code null}
483   *
484   * @see javax.lang.model.util.Elements#getModuleElement(CharSequence)
485   *
486   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-7.html#jls-7.7 Java Language Specification, section
487   * 7.7
488   */
489  public ModuleElement moduleElement(final CharSequence qualifiedName);
490
491  /**
492   * Returns a {@link Name} representing the supplied {@link CharSequence}.
493   *
494   * @param name a {@link CharSequence}; must not be {@code null}
495   *
496   * @return a non-{@code null} {@link Name} representing the supplied {@link name}
497   *
498   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code name} is {@code null}
499   *
500   * @see #lock()
501   *
502   * @see javax.lang.model.util.Elements#getName(CharSequence)
503   */
504  public Name name(final CharSequence name);
505
506  /**
507   * Returns a {@link NoType} {@linkplain TypeMirror#getKind() bearing} the supplied {@link TypeKind}, if the supplied
508   * {@link TypeKind} is either {@link TypeKind#NONE} or {@link TypeKind#VOID}.
509   *
510   * @param kind a {@link TypeKind}; must be either {@link TypeKind#NONE} or {@link TypeKind#VOID}
511   *
512   * @return a non-{@code null} {@link NoType} {@linkplain TypeMirror#getKind() bearing} the supplied {@link TypeKind}
513   *
514   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code kind} is {@code null}
515   *
516   * @exception IllegalArgumentException if {@code kind} is non-{@code null} and neither {@link TypeKind#NONE} nor
517   * {@link TypeKind#VOID}
518   *
519   * @see TypeKind#NONE
520   *
521   * @see TypeKind#VOID
522   *
523   * @see javax.lang.model.util.Types#getNoType(TypeKind)
524   *
525   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-8.html#jls-8.4.5 Java Language Specification, section
526   * 8.4.5
527   */
528  public NoType noType(final TypeKind kind);
529
530  /**
531   * Returns a {@link NullType} implementation {@linkplain TypeMirror#getKind() whose <code>TypeKind</code>} is {@link
532   * TypeKind#NULL}.
533   *
534   * @return a non-{@code null} {@link NullType}
535   *
536   * @see javax.lang.model.util.Types#getNullType()
537   *
538   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.1 Java Language Specification, section 4.1
539   */
540  public NullType nullType();
541
542  /**
543   * Returns a {@link PackageElement} representing the package bearing the supplied {@code canonicalName}, or {@code null}
544   * if there is no such {@link PackageElement}.
545   *
546   * @param canonicalName a canonical name suitable for naming a package; must not be {@code null}; may be {@linkplain
547   * CharSequence#isEmpty() empty}, in which case a {@link ModuleElement} representing an <dfn>unnamed package</dfn> will
548   * be returned
549   *
550   * @return a {@link PackageElement}, or {@code null}
551   *
552   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code canonicalName} is {@code null}
553   *
554   * @see javax.lang.model.util.Elements#getPackageElement(CharSequence)
555   *
556   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-6.html#jls-6.7 Java Language Specification, section
557   * 6.7
558   */
559  public PackageElement packageElement(final CharSequence canonicalName);
560
561  /**
562   * Returns a {@link PackageElement} representing the package bearing the supplied {@code canonicalName} as seen from
563   * the module represented by the supplied {@link ModuleElement}, or {@code null} if there is no such {@link
564   * PackageElement}.
565   *
566   * @param asSeenFrom a {@link ModuleElement}; must not be {@code null}
567   *
568   * @param canonicalName a canonical name suitable for naming a package; must not be {@code null}; may be {@linkplain
569   * CharSequence#isEmpty() empty}, in which case a {@link ModuleElement} representing an <dfn>unnamed package</dfn> will
570   * be returned
571   *
572   * @return a {@link PackageElement}, or {@code null}
573   *
574   * @exception NullPointerException if either {@code asSeenFrom} or {@code canonicalName} is {@code null}
575   *
576   * @see javax.lang.model.util.Elements#getPackageElement(ModuleElement, CharSequence)
577   *
578   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-6.html#jls-6.7 Java Language Specification, section
579   * 6.7
580   */
581  public PackageElement packageElement(final ModuleElement asSeenFrom, final CharSequence canonicalName);
582
583  /**
584   * Returns the result of applying <dfn>unboxing conversion</dfn> to the (logical) {@link TypeElement} bearing the
585   * supplied {@code canonicalName}.
586   *
587   * @param canonicalName a canonical name of either a primitive type or a so-called "wrapper" type; must not be {@code
588   * null}
589   *
590   * @return a non-{@code null} {@link PrimitiveType} with a {@linkplain TypeKind#isPrimitive() primitive} {@link
591   * TypeKind}
592   *
593   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code canonicalName} is {@code null}
594   *
595   * @exception IllegalArgumentException if {@code canonicalName} {@linkplain #toString(CharSequence) converted to a
596   * <code>String</code>} {@linkplain String#equals(Object) is not equal to} {@code boolean}, {@code byte}, {@code
597   * char}, {@code double}, {@code float}, {@code int}, {@code long}, {@code short}, {@link Boolean java.lang.Boolean},
598   * {@link Byte java.lang.Byte}, {@link Character java.lang.Character}, {@link Double java.lang.Double}, {@link Float
599   * java.lang.Float}, {@link Integer java.lang.Integer}, {@link Long java.lang.Long}, or {@link Short java.lang.Short}
600   *
601   * @see #primitiveType(TypeKind)
602   *
603   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-5.html#jls-5.1.8 Java Language Specification, section
604   * 5.1.8
605   *
606   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-6.html#jls-6.7 Java Language Specification, section
607   * 6.7
608   */
609  // (Convenience.)
610  // (Unboxing.)
611  public default PrimitiveType primitiveType(final CharSequence canonicalName) {
612    final String s = this.toString(Objects.requireNonNull(canonicalName, "canonicalName"));
613    return switch (s) {
614    case "boolean", "java.lang.Boolean" -> this.primitiveType(TypeKind.BOOLEAN);
615    case "byte", "java.lang.Byte" -> this.primitiveType(TypeKind.BYTE);
616    case "char", "java.lang.Character" -> this.primitiveType(TypeKind.CHAR);
617    case "double", "java.lang.Double" -> this.primitiveType(TypeKind.DOUBLE);
618    case "float", "java.lang.Float" -> this.primitiveType(TypeKind.FLOAT);
619    case "int", "java.lang.Integer" -> this.primitiveType(TypeKind.INT);
620    case "long", "java.lang.Long" -> this.primitiveType(TypeKind.LONG);
621    case "short", "java.lang.Short" -> this.primitiveType(TypeKind.SHORT);
622    default -> throw new IllegalArgumentException("canonicalName: " + s);
623    };
624  }
625
626  /**
627   * Returns the result of applying <dfn>unboxing conversion</dfn> to the {@linkplain Element#asType() type declared by
628   * the supplied <code>TypeElement</code>}.
629   *
630   * @param e a {@link TypeElement}; must not be {@code null}
631   *
632   * @return a non-{@code null} {@link PrimitiveType} with a {@linkplain TypeKind#isPrimitive() primitive} {@link
633   * TypeKind}
634   *
635   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code e} is {@code null}
636   *
637   * @exception IllegalArgumentException if there is no unboxing conversion that can be applied to the {@linkplain
638   * Element#asType() type declared by <code>e</code>}
639   *
640   * @see javax.lang.model.util.Types#unboxedType(TypeMirror)
641   *
642   * @see #primitiveType(TypeMirror)
643   *
644   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-5.html#jls-5.1.8 Java Language Specification, section
645   * 5.1.8
646   */
647  // (Convenience.)
648  // (Unboxing.)
649  public default PrimitiveType primitiveType(final TypeElement e) {
650    return this.primitiveType(e.asType());
651  }

653  /**
654   * Returns the {@link PrimitiveType} corresponding to the supplied {@link TypeKind} (if it {@linkplain
655   * TypeKind#isPrimitive() is primitive}).

658   *

660   * TypeKind#isPrimitive() primitive} {@link TypeKind}
661   *
662   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code kind} is {@code null}
663   *
664   * @exception IllegalArgumentException if {@code kind} {@linkplain TypeKind#isPrimitive() is not primitive}
665   *
666   * @see javax.lang.model.util.Types#getPrimitiveType(TypeKind)
667   *
668   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.2 Java Language Specification, section
669   * 4.2
670   */
671  // (Canonical.)
672  public PrimitiveType primitiveType(final TypeKind kind);

674  /**
675   * Returns the result of applying <dfn>unboxing conversion</dfn> to the supplied {@link TypeMirror}.
676   *
677   * @param t a {@link TypeMirror}; must not be {@code null}
678   *
679   * @return a non-{@code null} {@link PrimitiveType} with a {@linkplain TypeKind#isPrimitive() primitive} {@link
680   * TypeKind}
681   *
682   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code t} is {@code null}
683   *
684   * @exception IllegalArgumentException if there is no unboxing conversion that can be applied to {@code t}
685   *
686   * @see javax.lang.model.util.Types#unboxedType(TypeMirror)
687   *
688   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-5.html#jls-5.1.8 Java Language Specification, section
689   * 5.1.8

691  // (Canonical.)
692  // (Unboxing.)
693  public PrimitiveType primitiveType(final TypeMirror t);

695  /**
696   * Returns a {@link RecordComponentElement} corresponding to the supplied {@link ExecutableElement}, or {@code null}
697   * if there is no such {@link RecordComponentElement}.
698   *
699   * @param e an {@link ExecutableElement} {@linkplain ExecutableElement#getEnclosingElement() enclosed by} a record
700   * representing an <dfn>accessor method</dfn>; must not be {@code null}
701   *
702   * @return a {@link RecordComponentElement} corresponding to the supplied {@link ExecutableElement}, or {@code null}
703   *
704   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code e} is {@code null}
705   *
706   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-8.html#jls-8.10.3 Java Language Specification, section
707   * 8.10.3
708   */
709  public RecordComponentElement recordComponentElement(final ExecutableElement e);
710
711  /**
712   * Returns {@code true} if and only if the two arguments represent the <dfn>same type</dfn>.
713   *
714   * <p>This method differs from the {@link javax.lang.model.util.Types#isSameType(TypeMirror, TypeMirror)} method in
715   * two ways:</p>
716   *
717   * <ul>
718   *
719   * <li>Its arguments may be {@code null}. If both arguments are {@code null}, {@code true} is returned. If only one
720   * argument is {@code null}, {@code false} is returned.</li>
721   *
722   * <li>If the same Java object reference is passed as both arguments, {@code true} is returned (even if it {@linkplain
723   * TypeMirror#getKind() has a <code>TypeKind</code>} of {@link TypeKind#WILDCARD}).</li>
724   *
725   * </ul>
726   *
727   * @param t0 the first {@link TypeMirror}; may be {@code null}
728   *
729   * @param t1 the second {@link TypeMirror}; may be {@code null}
730   *
731   * @return {@code true} if and only if the two arguments represent the <dfn>same type</dfn>; {@code false} otherwise
732   *
733   * @see javax.lang.model.util.Types#isSameType(TypeMirror, TypeMirror)
734   *
735   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.3.4 Java Language Specification, section
736   * 4.3.4
737   *
738   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.5.1 Java Language Specification, section
739   * 4.5.1
740   */
741  public boolean sameType(final TypeMirror t0, final TypeMirror t1);
742
743  /**
744   * Returns {@code true} if and only if {@code et0} is a <dfn>subsignature</dfn> of {@code et1}.
745   *
746   * @param et0 the first {@link ExecutableType}; must not be {@code null}
747   *
748   * @param et1 the second {@link ExecutableType}; must not be {@code null}
749   *
750   * @return {@code true} if and only if {@code et0} is a <dfn>subsignature</dfn> of {@code et1}
751   *
752   * @exception NullPointerException if either argument is {@code null}
753   *
754   * @exception ClassCastException if this method is implemented in terms of the {@link
755   * javax.lang.model.util.Types#isSubsignature(ExecutableType, ExecutableType)} method, and if each of the supplied
756   * {@link ExecutableType} arguments does not have an {@linkplain TypeKind#EXECUTABLE <code>EXECUTABLE</code>
757   * <code>TypeKind</code>}; this exception type is undocumented by the {@link
758   * javax.lang.model.util.Types#isSubsignature(ExecutableType, ExecutableType)} method and so is subject to change
759   * without prior notice
760   *
761   * @see javax.lang.model.util.Types#isSubsignature(ExecutableType, ExecutableType)
762   *
763   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-8.html#jls-8.4.2 Java Language Specification, section
764   * 8.4.2
765   */
766  public boolean subsignature(final ExecutableType et0, final ExecutableType et1);
767
768  /**
769   * Returns {@code true} if and only if {@code candidateSubtype} is a <dfn>subtype</dfn> of {@code supertype}.
770   *
771   * @param candidateSubtype the first {@link TypeMirror}; must not be {@code null}
772   *
773   * @param supertype the second {@link TypeMirror}; must not be {@code null}
774   *
775   * @return {@code true} if and only if {@code candidateSubtype} is a <dfn>subtype</dfn> of {@code supertype}
776   *
777   * @exception NullPointerException if either argument is {@code null}
778   *
779   * @see javax.lang.model.util.Types#isSubtype(TypeMirror, TypeMirror)
780   *
781   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.10 Java Language Specification, section
782   * 4.10
783   */
784  public boolean subtype(TypeMirror candidateSubtype, TypeMirror supertype);
785
786  /**
787   * Converts the supplied {@link CharSequence}, which is often a {@link Name}, into a {@link String}, and returns the
788   * conversion, {@linkplain #lock() locking} when appropriate to serialize symbol completion.
789   *
790   * @param name the {@link CharSequence} to convert; may be {@code null} in which case {@code null} will be returned
791   *
792   * @return a {@link String}, or {@code null} if {@code name} was {@code null}
793   *
794   * @see #lock()
795   */
796  public default String toString(final CharSequence name) {
797    return switch (name) {
798    case null -> null;
799    case String s -> s;
800    case Name n -> {
801      try (var lock = this.lock()) {
802        yield n.toString();
803      }
804    }
805    default -> name.toString();
806    };
807  }
808
809  /**
810   * Returns a {@link TypeElement} representing the element bearing the supplied <dfn>canonical name</dfn>, or {@code
811   * null} if there is no such {@link TypeElement}.
812   *
813   * @param canonicalName a valid canonical name; must not be {@code null}
814   *
815   * @return a {@link TypeElement}, or {@code null}
816   *
817   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code canonicalName} is {@code null}
818   *
819   * @see javax.lang.model.util.Elements#getTypeElement(CharSequence)
820   *
821   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-6.html#jls-6.7 Java Language Specification, section
822   * 6.7
823   */
824  public TypeElement typeElement(final CharSequence canonicalName);
825
826  /**
827   * Returns a {@link TypeElement} representing the element bearing the supplied <dfn>canonical name</dfn>, as read or
828   * seen from the module represented by the supplied {@link ModuleElement}, or {@code null} if there is no such {@link
829   * TypeElement}.
830   *
831   * @param asSeenFrom a {@link ModuleElement}; must not be {@code null}
832   *
833   * @param canonicalName a valid canonical name; must not be {@code null}
834   *
835   * @return a {@link TypeElement}, or {@code null}
836   *
837   * @exception NullPointerException if either {@code asSeenFrom} or {@code canonicalName} is {@code null}
838   *
839   * @see javax.lang.model.util.Elements#getTypeElement(ModuleElement, CharSequence)
840   *
841   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-6.html#jls-6.7 Java Language Specification, section
842   * 6.7
843   */
844  public TypeElement typeElement(final ModuleElement asSeenFrom, final CharSequence canonicalName);
845
846  /**
847   * Returns a {@link TypeElement} representing the result of applying <dfn>boxing conversion</dfn> to the primitive
848   * type represented by the supplied {@link PrimitiveType} argument.
849   *
850   * <p>The default implementation of this method calls the {@link #typeElement(TypeKind)} method with the supplied
851   * {@link PrimitiveType}'s {@linkplain TypeMirror#getKind() affiliated <code>TypeKind</code>} and returns its
852   * result.</p>
853   *
854   * @param t a {@link PrimitiveType} with a {@link TypeKind} that {@linkplain TypeKind#isPrimitive() is primitive};
855   * must not be {@code null}
856   *
857   * @return a non-{@code null} {@link TypeElement} representing the result of applying boxing conversion to the
858   * supplied argument
859   *
860   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code t} is {@code null}
861   *
862   * @exception ClassCastException if this method is implemented in terms of the {@link
863   * javax.lang.model.util.Types#boxedClass(PrimitiveType)} method, and if the supplied {@link PrimitiveType} does not
864   * have a {@linkplain TypeKind#isPrimitive() primitive <code>TypeKind</code>}; this exception type is undocumented by
865   * the {@link javax.lang.model.util.Types#boxedClass(PrimitiveType)} method and so is subject to change without prior
866   * notice
867   *
868   * @exception IllegalArgumentException if {@code primitiveTypeKind} {@linkplain TypeKind#isPrimitive() is not
869   * primitive}
870   *
871   * @see #typeElement(TypeKind)
872   *
873   * @see javax.lang.model.util.Types#boxedClass(PrimitiveType)
874   *
875   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-5.html#jls-5.1.7 Java Language Specification, section
876   * 5.1.7
877   */
878  // (Canonical.)
879  // (Boxing.)
880  public default TypeElement typeElement(final PrimitiveType t) {
881    try (var lock = this.lock()) {
882      return this.typeElement(t.getKind());
883    }
884  }
885
886  /**
887   * Returns a {@link TypeElement} representing the result of applying <dfn>boxing conversion</dfn> to the primitive
888   * type represented by the supplied {@link TypeKind} argument, if it {@linkplain TypeKind#isPrimitive() is primitive}.
889   *
890   * @param primitiveTypeKind a {@link TypeKind} that {@linkplain TypeKind#isPrimitive() is primitive}; must not be
891   * {@code null}
892   *
893   * @return a non-{@code null} {@link TypeElement} representing the result of applying boxing conversion to the
894   * supplied argument
895   *
896   * @exception IllegalArgumentException if {@code primitiveTypeKind} {@linkplain TypeKind#isPrimitive() is not
897   * primitive}
898   *
899   * @see #typeElement(PrimitiveType)
900   *
901   * @see javax.lang.model.util.Types#boxedClass(PrimitiveType)
902   *
903   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-5.html#jls-5.1.7 Java Language Specification, section
904   * 5.1.7
905   */
906  // (Convenience.)
907  // (Boxing.)
908  public default TypeElement typeElement(final TypeKind primitiveTypeKind) {
909    return switch (primitiveTypeKind) {
910    case BOOLEAN -> this.typeElement("java.lang.Boolean");
911    case BYTE -> this.typeElement("java.lang.Byte");
912    case CHAR -> this.typeElement("java.lang.Character");
913    case DOUBLE -> this.typeElement("java.lang.Double");
914    case FLOAT -> this.typeElement("java.lang.Float");
915    case INT -> this.typeElement("java.lang.Integer");
916    case LONG -> this.typeElement("java.lang.Long");
917    case SHORT -> this.typeElement("java.lang.Short");
918    default -> throw new IllegalArgumentException("primitiveTypeKind: " + primitiveTypeKind);
919    };
920  }
921
922  /**
923   * Returns the {@link TypeParameterElement} {@linkplain Parameterizable#getTypeParameters() contained} by the supplied
924   * {@link Parameterizable} whose {@linkplain TypeParameterElement#getSimpleName() name} {@linkplain
925   * Name#contentEquals(CharSequence) is equal to} the supplied {@code name}, or {@code null} if there is no such {@link
926   * TypeParameterElement}.
927   *
928   * @param p a {@link Parameterizable}; must not be {@code null}
929   *
930   * @param name a name valid for a type parameter; must not be {@code null}
931   *
932   * @return a {@link TypeParameterElement}, or {@code null}
933   */
934  public default TypeParameterElement typeParameterElement(Parameterizable p, final CharSequence name) {
935    Objects.requireNonNull(p, "p");
936    Objects.requireNonNull(name, "name");
937    while (p != null) {
938      // A call to getTypeParameters() does not cause symbol completion, but name acquisition also needs to be
939      // serialized globally.
940      try (var lock = this.lock()) {
941        for (final TypeParameterElement tpe : p.getTypeParameters()) {
942          if (tpe.getSimpleName().contentEquals(name)) {
943            return tpe;
944          }
945        }
946      }
947      p = switch (p) {
948      case ExecutableElement ee -> (Parameterizable)ee.getEnclosingElement();
949      case TypeElement te -> (Parameterizable)te.getEnclosingElement();
950      default -> null;
951      };
952    }
953    return null;
954  }
955
956  /**
957   * A convenience method that returns the {@link TypeVariable} {@linkplain TypeParameterElement#asType() declared by}
958   * the {@link TypeParameterElement} {@linkplain Parameterizable#getTypeParameters() contained} by the supplied {@link
959   * Parameterizable} whose {@linkplain TypeParameterElement#getSimpleName() name} {@linkplain
960   * Name#contentEquals(CharSequence) is equal to} the supplied {@code name}, or {@code null} if there is no such {@link
961   * TypeParameterElement} or {@link TypeVariable}.
962   *
963   * @param p a {@link Parameterizable}; must not be {@code null}
964   *
965   * @param name a name valid for a type parameter; must not be {@code null}
966   *
967   * @return a {@link TypeVariable}, or {@code null}
968   *
969   * @see #typeParameterElement(Parameterizable, CharSequence)
970   */
971  public default TypeVariable typeVariable(Parameterizable p, final CharSequence name) {
972    final TypeParameterElement e = this.typeParameterElement(p, name);
973    return e == null ? null : (TypeVariable)e.asType();
974  }
975
976  /**
977   * A convenience method that returns the first {@link VariableElement} with a {@linkplain
978   * javax.lang.model.element.ElementKind#isVariable() variable <code>ElementKind</code>} and {@linkplain
979   * Element#getSimpleName() bearing} the supplied {@code simpleName} that the supplied {@code enclosingElement}
980   * {@linkplain Element#getEnclosedElements() encloses}, or {@code null} if there is no such {@link VariableElement}.
981   *
982   * @param enclosingElement an {@link Element}; must not be {@code null}
983   *
984   * @param simpleName a {@link CharSequence}; must not be {@code null}
985   *
986   * @return a {@link VariableElement}, or {@code null}
987   *
988   * @exception NullPointerException if either argument is {@code null}
989   *
990   * @see Element#getEnclosedElements()
991   *
992   * @see javax.lang.model.element.ElementKind#isVariable()
993   *
994   * @see Element#getSimpleName()
995   *
996   * @see VariableElement
997   */
998  public default VariableElement variableElement(final Element enclosingElement, final CharSequence simpleName) {
999    Objects.requireNonNull(simpleName, "simpleName");
1000    try (var lock = lock()) {
1001      for (final Element ee : enclosingElement.getEnclosedElements()) {
1002        if (ee.getKind().isVariable() && ee.getSimpleName().contentEquals(simpleName)) {
1003          return (VariableElement)ee;
1004        }
1005      }
1006    }
1007    return null;
1008  }
1009
1010  /**
1011   * A convenience method that returns a new {@link WildcardType} {@linkplain TypeMirror#getKind() with a
1012   * <code>TypeKind</code>} of {@link TypeKind#WILDCARD}, an {@linkplain WildcardType#getExtendsBound() extends bound}
1013   * of {@code null}, and a {@linkplain WildcardType#getSuperBound() super bound} of {@code null}.
1014   *
1015   * @return a new, non-{@code null} {@link WildcardType}
1016   *
1017   * @see #wildcardType(TypeMirror, TypeMirror)
1018   *
1019   * @see javax.lang.model.util.Types#getWildcardType(TypeMirror, TypeMirror)
1020   *
1021   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.5.1 Java Language Specification, section
1022   * 4.5.1
1023   */
1024  public default WildcardType wildcardType() {
1025    return this.wildcardType(null, null);
1026  }
1027
1028  /**
1029   * Returns a new {@link WildcardType} {@linkplain TypeMirror#getKind() with a <code>TypeKind</code>} of {@link
1030   * TypeKind#WILDCARD}, an {@linkplain WildcardType#getExtendsBound() extends bound} of the supplied {@code
1031   * extendsBound}, and a {@linkplain WildcardType#getSuperBound() super bound} of the supplied {@code superBound}.
1032   *
1033   * <p>Any argument may be {@code null}. Both arguments may not be non-{@code null}.</p>
1034   *
1035   * @param extendsBound the upper bound of the new {@link WildcardType}; may be {@code null}
1036   *
1037   * @param superBound the lower bound of the new {@link WildcardType}; may be {@code null}
1038   *
1039   * @return a new, non-{@code null} {@link WildcardType}
1040   *
1041   * @exception IllegalArgumentException if both arguments are non-{@code null} or otherwise unsuitable for being the
1042   * bounds of a {@link WildcardType}
1043   *
1044   * @see javax.lang.model.util.Types#getWildcardType(TypeMirror, TypeMirror)
1045   *
1046   * @spec https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se23/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.5.1 Java Language Specification, section
1047   * 4.5.1
1048   */
1049  public WildcardType wildcardType(TypeMirror extendsBound, TypeMirror superBound);
1050
1051}
